description: The problem is to find a four-digit whole number n, such that the last four digits of n^2 are in fact the original number n. The number n is within the range of 1000 to 9999. The number n^2 is within the range of 1000000 to 99980001. The problem also involves converting the number n and n^2 into arrays of their digits. The problem is solved when the last four digits of n^2 match the digits of n and the square of n equals n^2.
